Package com.shouldis.bitset

Class XOrShift

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shouldis.bitset.XOrShift
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DensityXOrShift
    public class XOrShift
extends java.lang.Object
    Pseudo-random number generator using a modified version of the XORShift64 algorithm to generate random values at a faster rate than Random's linear congruent generator. This generator has a period of 264 -1.
    See Also:
    DensityXOrShift

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static long MAGIC_NUMBER
      Magic number value used to deterministically add entropy to seeds.
      private static java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong SEED_ENTROPY
      Atomic value used to ensure that seeds generated at similar times are sufficiently different.
      private long state
      Internal value used to store the current value held by this generator.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      XOrShift()
      Creates an instance of XOrShift with a randomly generated seed.
      XOrShift​(long state)
      Creates an instance of XOrShift initialized by the specified seed.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected static long generateSeed()
      Randomly generates a seed using entropy from SEED_ENTROPY and the System.nanoTime().
      BitSet nextBitSet​(int size)
      Generates a BitSet with the specified size, with each word filled with nextInt().
      boolean nextBoolean()
      Returns the next pseudo-random boolean from this random number generator's sequence.
      ConcurrentBitSet nextConcurrentBitSet​(int size)
      Generates a ConcurrentBitSet with the specified size, with each word filled with nextInt().
      double nextDouble()
      Returns the next pseudo-random double from this random number generator's sequence, with values ranging from 0.0 (inclusive) to 1.0 (exclusive).
      float nextFloat()
      Returns the next pseudo-random float from this random number generator's sequence, with values ranging from 0.0 (inclusive) to 1.0 (exclusive).
      int nextInt()
      Returns the next pseudo-random integer from this random number generator's sequence.
      int nextInt​(int bound)
      Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed integer value from this random number generator's sequence, which will be in the range 0 (inclusive) to bound (exclusive).
      long nextLong()
      Returns the next pseudo-random long from this random number generator's sequence.
      long nextLong​(long bound)
      Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed long value from this random number generator's sequence, which will be in the range 0 (inclusive) to bound (exclusive).
      int nextPositiveInt()
      Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed integer value from this random number generator's sequence, but shifted to ensure it is always positive.
      long nextPositiveLong()
      Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed long value from this random number generator's sequence, but shifted to ensure it is always positive.
      private int nextRawInt()
      Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed integer value from this random number generator's sequence.
      private long nextRawLong()
      Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed long value from this random number generator's sequence.
      void setSeed​(long seed)
      Changes the seed of this random number generator.

        public XOrShift​(long state)

        Parameters:
        state - the value used to initialize the state of this generator.

        Returns the next pseudo-random long from this random number generator's sequence.
        Returns:

      • nextLong

        public final long nextLong​(long bound)
        Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed long value from this random number generator's sequence, which will be in the range 0 (inclusive) to bound (exclusive).
        Parameters:
        bound - the upper bound of the range of generated longs.
        Returns:
        the next long between 0 and bound.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if bound is less than 1;

      • nextInt

        public int nextInt()
        Returns the next pseudo-random integer from this random number generator's sequence.
        Returns:
        a randomly generated integer.

      • nextInt

        public final int nextInt​(int bound)
        Returns the next pseudo-random, uniformly distributed integer value from this random number generator's sequence, which will be in the range 0 (inclusive) to bound (exclusive).
        Parameters:
        bound - the upper bound of the range of generated integers.
        Returns:
        the next integer between 0 and bound.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if bound is less than 1;

      • nextBitSet

        public final BitSet nextBitSet​(int size)
        Generates a BitSet with the specified size, with each word filled with nextInt().
        Parameters:
        size - the size of generated BitSet.
        Returns:
        a randomly generated BitSet with the specified size.

      • nextConcurrentBitSet

        public final ConcurrentBitSet nextConcurrentBitSet​(int size)
        Generates a ConcurrentBitSet with the specified size, with each word filled with nextInt().

        This is more efficient than initializing a ConcurrentBitSet with ConcurrentBitSet.randomize(XOrShift).

        Parameters:
        size - the size of the generated ConcurrentBitSet.
        Returns:
        a randomly generated ConcurrentBitSet with the specified size.

      • setSeed

        public final void setSeed​(long seed)
        Changes the seed of this random number generator. If the specified seed is 0, then a random seed with be generated and used instead.
        Parameters:
        seed - the seed used to change to state of this XOrShift.

      • generateSeed

        protected static final long generateSeed()
        Randomly generates a seed using entropy from SEED_ENTROPY and the System.nanoTime().
        Returns:
        a randomly generated seed.
